topics.body:
"Normal" is 57F - 88F on that scale

"Normal" should at LEAST start at 75F and end at maybe 100F

And where's regular "Hot?" That'd be like 100F-115F.

"Very Hot" is anything above 115F, even at that point I start getting uncomfortable

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554550fa63687254a1591500#post_554550fa63687254a1591500
I've been in 122F/50C before... I survived :3

"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5545519163687262c7350000#post_5545519163687262c7350000
That's because of the humidity. People don't understand that humidity creates a false illusion of heat. 

85F+ anywhere other than the Southwest (and by that I mean California/Arizona/Nevada/Utah/New Mexico) is unbearable because it's muggy as hell. 

Even 105F here is perfect because the air is so dry you don't feel it, just the heat of the sun.

"@Zak_Inc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5545522663687262ba160100#post_5545522663687262ba160100
How hot? I'm interested
